column4: I ran firestarter and am not happy with the results, my machine reports nat errors in azureus and such.  If I start firestarter and then stop the firewall everything is ok.  what can I do to remove all the rules that it created? Will using synaptic and uninstalling(removing all configuration files) result in fixing this?  When I reboot I have to stop it to get rid of its ruleset, it starts automatically.

hmm, well, you can uninstall it, sure. as i recall, it places a startup script in /etc/init.d/firestarter (or something like that), where it initializes the iptables ruleset to whatever it wants it to be.
